text: DIM thro' the sculptured aisles the sunbeam falls%% More like a dream
More like a dream%% Of some imagined beam,
Of some imagined beam, Than actual daylight over mortal walls.
Than actual daylight over mortal walls. A strain of music like the rushing wind,
A strain of music like the rushing wind, But deep and sweet
But deep and sweet%% As when the waters meet
As when the waters meet%% In one mysterious harmony combined.
In one mysterious harmony combined. So swells the mighty organ, rich and full,
So swells the mighty organ, rich and full, As if it were the soul
As if it were the soul%% Which raised the glorious whole
Which raised the glorious whole%% Of that fair building, vast and wonderful.
Of that fair building, vast and wonderful. Doth not the spirit feel its influence,
Doth not the spirit feel its influence, All vain and feverish care,
All vain and feverish care, All thoughts that worldly are,
All thoughts that worldly are, Strife, tumult, mirth, and fear are vanished hence.
Strife, tumult, mirth, and fear are vanished hence. The world is put aside, within the heart
The world is put aside, within the heart%% Those hopes arise
Those hopes arise%% Thrice sacred mysteries,
Thrice sacred mysteries, In which our earthly nature has no part.
In which our earthly nature has no part. Oh, Christian Fane, the soul expands in thee,
Oh, Christian Fane, the soul expands in thee, Thine altar and thy tomb
Thine altar and thy tomb%% Speak of the hope and doom
Speak of the hope and doom%% Which leads and cheers man to eternity.
